reviews.review: Un capolavoro,  nient'altro da dire.

Wow, einfach nur wow. Als ich es zum ersten mal gespielt hab, ist mir nichts anderes eingefallen. Doch damit nicht genug, die Umsetzung von dem alten was eigentlich in jedem der mitlerweile vier Teile von Bioshok vorhanden ist zusammen mit dem neuen was in diesem Teil der Bioshok-Reihe am besten zur Geltung gebracht wurde, meiner Meinung nach, ist brilliant auch wenn das seinen Preis hat. Was ich damit meine ist die Leistung die es erfordert das spiel auf HD oder sogar Ultra-HD zu spielen ist enorm. Trotz dieses kleinen Mangels ist das Spiel nur zu empfehlen.


MfG Fabian

BIOSHOCKシリーズの現段階の最新作ということで前から気になっていたので購入。
スチームパンクのFPSということでとても気になっていました
これを書いてる時はINFINITEプレイ後、１と２も購入してからとなります。

後から知ったのですが過去作２つであったマルチエンディングが今作では無くなってるみたいですね。
ストーリーは最近主流のタイムパラドックスタイプのものでしたが十分楽しめました。
１、２でできなかったダッシュ機能や、格闘用のキーが別にあるのはかなり嬉しかったです。
空中都市ということであちこちにレールがあり、それを使って高速移動しつつ、物体を出現させるギミックが新たに追加されたことで戦闘に幅広さができたと思います。ステージ全体像も１、２と比べてかなり広く感じます。

ここから短所に関しても。
シリーズ通してですが、ビガー（前作でのプラスミドに当たる特殊能力）と武器選択を間違えてしまったり他のFPSと違い、右クリックでビガーによる特殊攻撃になるので（ズームは中央キー、過去作では初期はVキーだったかと）こちらも最初混乱してしまいます。
一部予期しないバグがあったりします（レールに乗ったら障害物にぶつかったまま降りられなくなりスタックする/本来地面から落下したら元の場所に無傷でテレポートするはずが一撃死してしまった等）


次にキャラクターに関して。
前作ではビッグダディやスプライサーといった特徴的な敵キャラクターがいましたが
今回も一新されながらいいキャラクターが勢揃いでした。
モーターパトリオット(海外ではMotorized Patriot)やハンディマンなどの強敵もグラフィック、攻撃方法共々なかなか見ていて 楽しく、又敵に回して辛い場面があったりとゲームとして重要な役割になってるのを実感しました。ただ、物語の重要な役割を持つはずのソングバードが敵として出るものの実際に戦う場面がないのが少し残念でした。

総括として
グラフィック面は文句無しでした(顔のテイストとしては人を選ぶかもしれませんが)。映画の様なストーリー展開で飽きることもなく最後まで楽しめます
ゲームとしては相手の放った弾丸がほぼ確実に当たる以外はストレスを感じませんでした
(DLCでは１、２でおなじみのラプチャーが舞台らしいですがそちらはまだ購入していないので分かりません)

First of all I'd like to say that I've never played a FPS before Bioshock Infinite, so this was a debut for me. 
That said I am absolutely in love with this game, I've finished it three times now (and am thus actually able to hit things now). 
I would recommend this game to everyone, even if you generally try to avoid the FPS genre. 
The story is amazing and complex, the characters very vivid and the replay value is high. This is one of the few games for which the gathering achievements actually makes sense. The scattered voice recordings in the world add another layer of depth to it, so I'd recommend listening to them. 
If you like story-rich and immersive games this is the game for you. I'd also recommend the DLC's (after playing the original two Bioshock games), those really made fall everything into place.
Everything a game should be. It balances action,narative,diverse combat and an plot-twist ending that'll leave you in awe for days.
I like it.

At first, I didn't know what to think. Later, I wondered if I was really playing the same BioShock or some kind of ripoff. Afterward, it felt like one of those incidents where the original writing team was forced to take a swan dive off the cliffs of Mt. Dummfuch and the universe was subjugated by a Mac Walters clone.

After playing through Burial At Sea I'm back to square one. I don't know what to think. They managed to tie in the first two games, but... the whole thing just left me feeling empty.

At least in the first two games it felt like the main character made some sort of difference, be it for good or ill. But with this "quantum metaphysics" nonsense added into the mix, all the protagonists just seem entirely superfluous to the events of both Rapture and Columbia.

The least they could do is patch the first two games so that they stand the test of time. Because now I just want to go back and pretend that Infinite is a completely separate story. Because on its own, it's great. It'd just be infinitely better if it truly were a stand-alone game. But since it interjects something which was entirely inevident beforehand (there were absolutely NO hints that Rapture was part some sort of pocket-multiverse spectrum in the first two games) I am reminded of things like ST:ENT and Starsiege Tribes. Because screw the original story, let's just punch a few holes in it and then take credit for filling those holes!

Don't get me wrong, I enjoyed every minute of Infinite and its DLC. I'm just frustrated at the exceedingly-prevalent scriptwriting trend (in games and beyond) to screw with things that really didn't need screwing with.

And now for one of my shameless plugs:

Still a better ending than ME3.

Beautiful game, engaging story, elegantly tied into the original Bioshock universe.  Play it.

Bioshock infinite is amazing. The graphical style and combat are just superb. The story is incredible, and is not something you will forget for a long time. The visual style which is a sort of steam punk neoclassical mix is exceptional and adds an incredible amount of character to the city of Columbia. The implementation of powers or "vigors" as they are called in game to help you in combat along side your gun is just exceptional. The story is where Bioshock Infinite really shines, it is expertly crafted and so complex and unique it is something you will rember for a long time. I highly recomend this game, a true masterpiece.

This game has some neat gameplay that will challenge hardcore FPS players. One of my favorite things about it was the fact that every playthrough will yield a different type of character because the clothing is randomized and the upgrades are expensive enough that you will only be able to specialize in a select few weapons/powers. The story is mind blowing and serves well as an Inception style mind bender, but the exploration of Columbia's racial themes is pedantic and childish, and can't be viewed as "sophisticated" by anyone over the age of 16. That doesn't make this any less than an amazing game, though. The graphics are state-of-the-art, the acting is phenomenal, and the gameplay is smooth right up until one boss fight close to the end of the game that nearly made me throw my keyboard. Other than that, get this game.
진짜 재미있다. 말이 필요없다. 플레이 마지막에 가면 모든 것이 정리되면서 알 수 있게 되는데 좀 충격적이었다. 발달한 공중도시에서 벌어지는 화끈한 슈팅을 즐기고 싶다면 꼭 해보길 바란다. 특히 게임을 플레이하면서 스카이라인 타고 돌아다니는 재미가 쏠쏠했음.

Even though I might be a little late to the party, I still wanted to play this game; which I was finally able to now, during the Steam Summer Sales.
I have played the first part of the game and up until now, it has been looking beautiful; the level design better than that of the previous two games; and the main game concepts very similar.
The worst thing so far in this game, however, are the controls. Why put melee on 'v'? That's a terrible default place for a melee weapon, especially considering that opening crates/looting bodies has been put on the 'f'-key. Which of those two will you need in the stressfull situations in which you might die within a second? Punching the guy in front of you with your hook-arm-thing, or looting the dead bodies strewn around, because they might just contain some +health? Exactly. [I swapped the two buttons immediately, when I learned that melee was 'v']
Other than the infuriating controls, I would still recommend this game, for both the stunning visuals and the fact that people have been rating this game highly. Now let's hope that I finish this game sometime within ten years...

una historia realmente atrapante, con unos actores de voz increibles (tanto la versión original como el doblaje al español).
En cuanto a la jugabilidad hubo algunos cambios con respecto a los dos anteriores como el limite de 2 armas y los plasmidos (ahora vigorizadores) renovados. 
El apartado grafico si bieno no es deslumbrante o hiper realista, diría yo que es acertado.
En fin un gran trabajo realmente,  es un juego indispensable para su biblioteca.
